FuncDef:
The ip direct-routing-table local-host-route advertise enable command enables a directly connected interface to advertise IPv4 host routes.
The undo ip direct-routing-table local-host-route advertise enable command disables a directly connected interface from advertising IPv4 host routes. The ip direct-routing-table local-host-route advertise enable command enables a directly connected interface to advertise IPv4 host routes. The undo ip direct-routing-table local-host-route advertise enable command disables a directly connected interface from advertising IPv4 host routes. By default, IPv4 host routes of directly connected interfaces are not advertised.
CLIs: undo ip direct-routing-table local-host-route advertise enable
ExtraInfo: By default, after a routing protocol imports an IPv4 host route from a directly connected interface, the routing protocol only stores the route in the routing table and does not advertise it. If IPv4 host routes need to be advertised, run the ip direct-routing-table local-host-route advertise enable command to enable the IPv4 host route advertisement function on the directly connected interface.
